AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: ATLAS provided largely relevant, product-specific troubleshooting and referenced appropriate KBs. There is no clear factual inaccuracy, broken-template behavior, unmet promise to send something, or explicit customer statement that the AI content was wrong/irrelevant (only that it did not resolve the issue).
evidence: 2025-10-10T07:49:27+00:00 // ATLAS: "Based on your report... two main symptoms: (1) Virus Scanning Engine (VSE) failures... and (2) an 'unexpected error' in the configuration interface..."
2025-10-10T09:23:11+00:00 // Customer: "Please note that all the suggested steps have already been completed. Unfortunately, these actions did not resolve the issue"

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: The customer did not explicitly request a human while being kept with AI responses, and there is no clear repetition of the same specific information request by AI 2+ times. After escalation, humans responded and requested additional diagnostics.
evidence: 2025-10-10T09:23:11+00:00 // Customer: "all the suggested steps have already been completed"
2025-10-12T04:12:15+00:00 // Human (Aditi Garg): provides a specific workaround and states engineering identified a file issue

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: While the customer stated earlier steps were already completed, the visible follow-ups shift to different actions (engineering workaround, then a bug-fix build, then additional targeted data collection). There is not clear, unambiguous evidence that support asked for the same exact steps/logs multiple times after being told they were already done/sent.
evidence: 2025-10-12T04:12:15+00:00 // Aditi Garg: "Our Engineering team has identified the issue... file — exploitdb.mdb — may not be copied... Temporary Workaround: ... Manually copy..."
2025-10-18T14:12:57+00:00 // Arafat Bakhsh: directs to upgrade to a specific "New_Release_Bug_Fix_22.2" and only then requests tracing/logs if it persists

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: There is a gap of 3+ calendar days between a customer update and the next support response.

2025-10-18T14:12:57+00:00 // Support (Arafat Bakhsh): next public response with new version/fix instructions (3+ days later)

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: No evidence the ticket was actually closed while an unanswered customer request remained. The messages shown only mention a standard 'ticket will stay open for one week unless...' policy, but do not show an actual closure event.
evidence: 2025-10-12T04:12:15+00:00 // Aditi Garg: "This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with \"This ticket can be closed\"..."
2025-10-20T13:36:00+00:00 // Pablo Ambram: repeats the same 'stay open for one week unless...' statement (still not a closure)

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: Although the customer impact is serious ("without email protection"), the explicit escalation/severity marker appears later and is acknowledged with priority adjustment. There is no clear evidence that, after being marked high severity, support only provided irrelevant/generic troubleshooting or failed to escalate.
